abstract: A second corporate advisory firm is urging shareholders of The New York Times Company to withhold their votes for directors at the company’s annual meeting this month, underscoring the mounting investor discontent over the dual-class share structure of the Times Company and some of the strategic decisions taken by management.
lead_paragraph: A second corporate advisory firm is urging shareholders of The New York Times Company to withhold their votes for directors at the company’s annual meeting this month, underscoring the mounting investor discontent over the dual-class share structure of the Times Company and some of the strategic decisions taken by management.

headline.main: Pressure Mounts on Times Co. as 2d Proxy Firm Enters Debate
